title: General
fullText:
Wiring systems shall be selected and installed to meet the following requirements —
(a) protect against physical contact with live parts by durable insulation materials; and
(b) satisfy current-carrying capacity, voltage drop and other minimum size requirements for conductors; and
(c) provide reliability and electrical continuity of connections, joints and terminations; and
(d) provide adequate strength of supports, suspensions and fixings; and
(e) suit intended use, including applications requiring a particular type of wiring system, e.g. fire-resistance; and
(f) protect against mechanical damage, environmental and other external influences by enclosure or other means; and
(g) be installed in accordance with the requirements of this section and the additional requirements as specified in the electrical equipment manufacturer's instructions.
Criteria for the selection and installation of wiring systems are as follows —
(i) conductor materials; and
(ii) core identification; and
(iii) insulation properties; and
(iv) temperature rise; and
(v) bending and tension limitations.
